content.question:
<math alttext="Z n solid plus 2 H C l aqueous produces Z n C l 2 aqueous plus H 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>ZnCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="Z n solid " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> reacts with <math alttext="H C l aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> according to the equation shown above. In trial 1 of a kinetics experiment, a <math alttext="5.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> piece of <math alttext="Z n solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to <math alttext="100 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.10 Molar H C l aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. The rate of reaction between <math alttext="Z n solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C l aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is determined by measuring the volume of <math alttext="H 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> produced over time. In trial 2 of the experiment, <math alttext="5.0 grams " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of powdered <math alttext="Z n solid " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to <math alttext="100 milliliters " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.10 Molar H C l aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which trial will have a faster initial rate of reaction and why?

choices.label: Trial 1, because there is a higher concentration of <math alttext="Z n solid " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in the reaction mixture.

Trial 1, because the sample of <math alttext="Z n solid " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> has less surface area for the reaction to take place.

Trial 2, because there is a higher concentration of <math alttext="H C l aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in the reaction mixture.

Trial 2, because the sample of <math alttext="Z n solid " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater surface area for the reaction to take place.

content.answer: Trial 2, because the sample of <math alttext="Z n solid " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater surface area for the reaction to take place.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
